item.description: Vehicle Fire; INC#1698; 09:26PM; 1300 N Drumm Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3s0fx5X; #Wilmington; PRELIM: (Unspecified Type) parked RV found well involved with fire. The remains of one person discovered within upon extinguishment. No other injuries. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Harbor Division (Incident #4469) and Coroner.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; AR1 E38; CH7; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1679; 09:09PM; 159 W 17th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3INtDOR; #Downtown; PRELIM: Two vehicle collision involving a police vehicle, with the other vehicle overturned and a possible entrapment. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Central Traffic Division (Incident #4288); FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; E10 E210 EM11 HR3 RA9 T10; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Traffic Collision; INC#1589; 08:25PM; 8225 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3raUsqo; #ManchesterSquare; Passenger vehicle vs Metro Transit Bus, with vehicle on fire, but no entrapment. Bus Driver says 6 patrons were on bus, but departed the scene after self-evacuating the bus. Five patients total at this time (4 from vehicle and 1 bus operator). Two of the patients from passenger vehicle are in critical condition, the others, including 2 children from the vehicle, and the Bus Driver, have lesser injuries. All expected to be transported by LAFD ambulance to area hospitals. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic Division (Incident #4014) and MTA Los Angeles (Metro); FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E33 E57 E66 EM13 RA266 RA33 RA66 RA857 T66; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1589; 08:06PM; 8225 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3raUsqo; #ManchesterSquare; PRELIM: Vehicle vs Transit Bus, with vehicle on fire. Multiple patients. ; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E33 E57 E66 EM13 RA266 RA33 RA66 RA857 T66; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1528; 07:21PM; NB 110 Fwy x Harry Bridges Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3aSnwdC; #Wilmington; A non-injury collision between a compact passenger vehicle and a semi-truck led to a spill of ~ 25 gallons diesel fuel in lanes of traffic. The spill has been contained on-site by LAFD responders, and clean-up will be coordinated through Caltrans. Closure of several lanes of NB 110 Freeway south of Harry Bridges Boulevard will continue until emergency operations and clean-up are complete, unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Monitor traffic reports on news radio and @CHP_LA_TRAFFIC on Twitter ( https://twitter.com/CHP_LA_TRAFFIC ) for roadway status. Media Inquiries: CHP South L.A. (Log #2897) and Caltrans; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E248 E48 E85 RA848 SH12 SQ48 T38 T48; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Report of Smoke; INC#1496; 06:57PM; 4929 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uabZAX; Sherman Oaks; A patient reportedly lit Emergency Room bedding on fire, which was extinguished prior to LAFD arrival. The burnt bed was moved outside, and smoke present *in the Emergency Room ONLY* on firefighter arrival, has been cleared with the use of LAFD ventilation fans. There was no LAFD rescue or medical support required for any patient or staff member. Thanks to quick early intervention by hospital staff, all Emergency Room patients were kept safe, and have been rehoused in that facility to continue on-site care. Pursuant to protocol, LAPD was requested and an LAFD Investigator has been assigned. Media Inquiries: LAPD Van Nuys Division (Incident #3760) and Sherman Oak Hospital Administration; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC14 E239 E288 E39 E88 E99 RA878 RA88 T39 T88; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1284; 04:47PM; 11900 W Victory Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rYOmZk; #NorthHollywood; Traffic Collision with one person trapped. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3190); FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E289 E60 E89 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA860 RA89 T60 T89 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - #BoydFire - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 01/28/2022 INC#0972

item.description: Knockdown - #BoydFire - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0972; 02:44PM; 212 E Boyd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/34gM53A; #Downtown; 102 Firefighters took just 38 minutes to access, confine and extinguish an outside fire in an alley behind a 50' x 200' row of one-story businesses that extended into one business, a restaurant supply company that included flammable gas canister storage. No injury. Fire cause under investigation. MEDIA: LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Cody Weireter is en route.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 BC9 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E17 E203 E209 E210 E211 E227 E4 E5 E9 EA1 EM1 HR3 JT1 JT3 PI3 RA11 RA4 RA809 RA827 SQ21 T10 T11 T27 T3 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire #BoydFire - 01/28/2022 INC#0972

item.description: Update #BoydFire - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0972; 02:40PM; 212 E Boyd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/34gM53A; Downtown; This offensive and still active firefight is at Greater Alarm status with 102 LAFD personnel assigned. An outside fire in an alley behind a 50' x 200' row of one-story businesses apparently extended through a rolling steel door to involve contents of a restaurant supply company that included flammable gas canister storage. ; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 BC9 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E17 E203 E209 E210 E211 E227 E4 E5 E9 EA1 EM1 HR3 JT1 JT3 PI3 RA11 RA4 RA809 RA827 SQ21 T10 T11 T27 T3 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey
